sentence.Network_en: Davis was never loquacious on the subject of his progeny.
sentence.Network_cn: 戴维斯说到他的子女时总是寡言少语。

sentence.Network_en: The normally loquacious Mr O'Reilly has said little.
sentence.Network_cn: 平常话多的奥赖利先生几乎没说什么。

sentence.Network_en: Kennedy had become almost as loquacious as Joe.
sentence.Network_cn: 肯尼迪变得和乔一样唠叨了.

list.abs: Kennedy had become almost as loquacious as Joe ., 肯尼迪变得和乔一样唠叨了.
Jack became loquacious on his favorite topic ., 杰克在他最喜爱的话题上变得口若悬河.
the shallowest persons are the most loquacious ., 最浅薄者最是饶舌.
loquacious , voluble , garrulous pithy爱讲话的

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Latin loquax, loquac- (from loqui 'talk') + -ious

entry.tran: 喋喋不休的；话多的；饶舌的
entry.def: If you describe someone as loquacious, you mean that they talk a lot.

example.ex: The normally loquacious Mr O'Reilly has said little.
example.tran: 平常话多的奥赖利先生几乎没说什么。

sentences.sentence: "kept from her housework by gabby neighbors"
